claim_target: Mohanlal Viswanathan, also known as Lalettan, is an Indian actor and producer predominantly working in the Malayalam film industry based in Kerala.
query: What is the name of the Indian actor and producer who is widely known as Lalettan and primarily works in the Malayalam film industry in Kerala?
evidence: M. P. Michael (2 December 1958), better known by his stage name Lal, is an Indian film director, actor, script writer, producer, and film distributor widely known for his work in Malayalam cinema. 14. Manoj K. Jayan Actor | Dhrona 2010 Manoj K. Jayan was born on March 15, 1966 in Kochi, Kerala, India. edited_claim: Lalettan, also known as Mohanlal Viswanathan, is an Indian actor and producer predominantly working in the Malayalam film industry based in Kerala.

claim_target: Prosenjit Chatterjee is a popular Indian actor, primarily working in Bengali cinema based in West Bengal, India. His career has been marked by critical success in his early years, followed by a lull, and a resurgence in popularity and commercial success later in his career.
query: What is the nature of Prosenjit Chatterjee's resurgence in popularity and commercial success later in his career?
evidence: The second turning point in Prosenjit’s career came with Srijit Mukherjee’s Autograph (2010). A tribute to Satyajit Ray’s 1966 film Nayak and Bengali superstar Uttam Kumar, the movie was a perfect blend between commercial and cerebral cinema. Prosenjit played an ageing superstar working with an ambitious director (Indraneil Sengupta), who would go to any length to make his film successful. It crossed more than 100 days of screening in West Bengal, Delhi, Mumbai, and Bengaluru.
edited_claim: Prosenjit Chatterjee is a popular Indian actor, primarily working in Bengali cinema based in West Bengal, India. His career has been marked by critical success in his early years, followed by a lull, a resurgence in popularity and commercial success later in his career with Autograph (2010). The movie was a perfect blend between commercial and cerebral cinema. Prosenjit played an ageing superstar working with an ambitious director (Indraneil Sengupta), who would go to any length to make his film successful. It crossed more than 100 days of screening in West Bengal, Delhi, Mumbai, and Bengaluru.
